intro: Pimpinella griffithiana, commonly known as the Himalayan cowparsley, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. Pimpinella griffithiana is valued for its ornamental appeal and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
